about.description:
Pint is a Python package to define, operate and manipulate physical
quantities: the product of a numerical value and a unit of measurement.
It allows arithmetic operations between them and conversions from and to
different units. It is distributed with a comprehensive list of physical
units, prefixes and constants. Due to its modular design, you can extend
(or even rewrite!) the complete list without changing the source code.
It supports a lot of numpy mathematical operations without monkey
patching or wrapping numpy.
about.summary: Operate and manipulate physical quantities in Python

script: python -c "import pint; ver = pint.__version__; assert ver != '0.0.0'"

about.description:
Pint is a Python package to define, operate and manipulate physical
quantities: the product of a numerical value and a unit of measurement.
It allows arithmetic operations between them and conversions from and to
different units. It is distributed with a comprehensive list of physical
units, prefixes and constants. Due to its modular design, you can extend
(or even rewrite!) the complete list without changing the source code.
It supports a lot of numpy mathematical operations without monkey
patching or wrapping numpy.
about.summary: Operate and manipulate physical quantities in Python

script: python -c "import pint; ver = pint.__version__; assert ver != '0.0.0'"

name: pint
raw_meta_yaml:
schema_version: 1

context:
  name: Pint
  version: "0.25.1"
  python_min: "3.11"

package:
  name: ${{ name|lower }}
  version: ${{ version }}

source:
  url: https://pypi.org/packages/source/${{ name[0] }}/${{ name }}/pint-${{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 34e6f89bfbfca94f29bde65c9ea42c1c56e05426692c655a3ee6f3ca2a92d252

build:
  number: 0
  noarch: python
  script: SETUPTOOLS_SCM_PRETEND_VERSION=${{ version }} ${{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . -v

requirements:
  host:
    - pip
    - python ${{ python_min }}.*
    - hatchling
  run:
    - python >=${{ python_min }}
    - platformdirs >=2.1.0
    - flexcache >=0.3
    - flexparser >=0.4
    - typing_extensions >=4.0.0
  run_constraints:
    - numpy >=1.23

tests:
  - python:
      imports:
        - pint
      python_version: ${{ python_min }}.*
  - requirements:
      run:
        - pip
        - python ${{ python_min }}.*
    script:
      - pip check
      - "python -c \"import pint; ver = pint.__version__; assert ver != '0.0.0'\""
      - pint-convert --help

about:
  license: BSD-3-Clause
  license_file: LICENSE
  summary: Operate and manipulate physical quantities in Python
  description: |
    Pint is a Python package to define, operate and manipulate physical
    quantities: the product of a numerical value and a unit of measurement.
    It allows arithmetic operations between them and conversions from and to
    different units. It is distributed with a comprehensive list of physical
    units, prefixes and constants. Due to its modular design, you can extend
    (or even rewrite!) the complete list without changing the source code.
    It supports a lot of numpy mathematical operations without monkey
    patching or wrapping numpy.
  homepage: https://github.com/hgrecco/pint
  repository: https://github.com/hgrecco/pint
  documentation: https://pint.readthedocs.org/

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - jan-janssen
    - dopplershift
